title: 111_s3586
content: The Act titled "Geothermal Exploration Act of 2010" includes a Geothermal Exploratory Drilling Loan Program. The Geothermal Exploration Act of 2010 establishes a direct loan program for high-risk geothermal exploration wells. Applicants can submit loan applications to the Secretary of Energy, who will consider project criteria when selecting loan recipients. The Secretary of Energy considers potential geothermal resources, applicant expertise, and project importance when selecting loan recipients. Preference is given to unexplored or underexplored geothermal resources. Data from exploratory wells must be shared for mapping national geothermal resources. The Secretary determines cost share and number of wells for geothermal projects eligible for loans under this section. Higher risk projects may receive a higher Federal share. Unproductive projects may receive further consideration. The Secretary may grant delays or waive repayment for unproductive geothermal projects. Repayment of loans for geothermal facilities begins 4 years after the loan is made or when the facility enters commercial production, with a 4-year term for repayment. The Geothermal Investment Fund, administered by the Secretary, is established in the Treasury of the United States. It is available without fiscal year limitation and not subject to appropriation. Amounts repaid on loans made under this section shall be deposited in the Fund, which may not be used for any other purpose. The Geothermal Investment Fund, administered by the Secretary, is established in the Treasury of the United States and is available without fiscal year limitation. Amounts repaid on loans made under this section shall be deposited in the Fund, which may not be used for any other purpose. The Secretary of Energy is required to submit an annual report to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources of the Senate and the Committee on Energy and Commerce of the House of Representatives within 60 days after the end of each fiscal year, detailing the operation of the Fund including amounts deposited and expenditures made. The Secretary must develop guidelines for the Geothermal Investment Fund program within 180 days of enactment. Appropriations are authorized for fiscal years 2011 through 2020 to fulfill the Fund's purpose. Recommendations for additional authorities and a statement of the Fund balance at the end of each fiscal year are required.
